longDef.en: an area of darkness, caused by light being blocked by something

examples.en: The children were playing, jumping on each other's shadows.
examples.cn: 孩子们正在嬉戏，跳来跳去踩彼此的影子。

examples.en: Jamie followed his mother around all day like a shadow.
examples.cn: 杰米像影子一样整天跟着他母亲。

examples.en: The sun shone through the leaves, casting/throwing shadows on the lawn.
examples.cn: 阳光透过树叶，在草地上投下阴影。

examples.en: This corner of the room is always in shadow (= slight darkness).
examples.cn: 房间的这个角落总是有些暗。

longDef.en: an area of darkness in which people and things cannot be seen

examples.en: Someone jumped out of the shadows and grabbed my handbag.
examples.cn: 有个人从阴暗处窜出，抢走了我的手提包。

longDef.en: a small dark area of skin under your eye

examples.en: She put on some make-up to cover the dark shadows under her eyes.
examples.cn: 她化了点妆来掩盖她眼睛下的黑眼圈。

longDef.en: to be very close to a larger building or place
longDef.cn: 离（某个大的建筑物或场所）很近

examples.en: His workshop was in the shadow of the great church of San Paolo Maggiore.
examples.cn: 他的工作坊离圣保罗大教堂很近。

longDef.en: to be in a situation in which something unpleasant either seems likely to happen and to have a bad effect on your life, or is already having a bad effect on your life

examples.en: We are all living under the shadow of war.
examples.cn: 我们都生活在战争的阴影中。

examples.en: It is a tragic story, but there is a shadow of hope.
examples.cn: 那是一个悲剧故事，但仍有一丝希望。

examples.en: There isn't a shadow of doubt that you've made the right decision.
examples.cn: 毫无疑问，你作出的决定是正确的。

longDef.en: If something is true beyond a shadow of a doubt, there is no doubt that it is true.

examples.en: This is without a shadow of a doubt the best movie I've seen all year.
examples.cn: 毫无疑问，这是我整年来看过最好的一部电影。

longDef.en: someone who follows another person everywhere
longDef.cn: 跟踪者，盯梢者;形影不离的人

examples.en: "I think we have a shadow on our tail," muttered the detective.
examples.cn: “我认为有人在跟踪我们，”侦探低声说。

examples.en: Ever since he was able to walk, Stephen has been his older brother's shadow (= has followed him and copied his actions).
examples.cn: 自从斯蒂芬会走路之后，就一直和他哥哥形影不离。

longDef.en: a person who follows someone else while they are at work in order to learn about that person's job

examples.en: The police think that the robbers shadowed their victims for days before the crime.
examples.cn: 警方认为抢劫者跟踪了受害人几天之后才实施犯罪的。

examples.en: The euro has closely shadowed the dollar.
examples.cn: 欧元紧跟美元。

longDef.en: to follow someone else while they are at work in order to learn about that person's job
longDef.cn: （为了解某人的工作而）跟随见习

examples.en: Your first week in the job will be spent shadowing one of our more experienced employees.
examples.cn: 你工作的第一周将是跟随我们其中一位经验丰富的雇员学习。

examples.en: We came across a glade shadowed by large trees.
examples.cn: 我们偶然发现了一块被大树遮蔽的空地。

longDef.en: to make a person unhappy or to make their life less happy

examples.en: Mental illness had shadowed him for more than a decade.
examples.cn: 十年来他的人生一直被精神疾病所困扰。

longDef.en: used in the title of important politicians in the main opposition party (= the party not in government)
longDef.cn: （用于主要反对党的要员的头衔中）影子的

examples.en: the Shadow Foreign Secretary
examples.cn: 影子外交大臣

examples.en: the Shadow Cabinet
examples.cn: 影子内阁
